verse: After we had returned to Jerusalem, made our offerings to Him, and begun to settle, the leaders notified me of a legal problem.
When I heard their story, I mourned for the Jews as if the nation were dead: I ripped my clothes, I ripped hair from my head and chin, and I sat in stunned silence
until the evening offering. All those who obeyed the True God of Israelâ€™s words and recognized the unfaithfulness of their neighbors joined me.
At the evening offering, I stopped mourning with the people and turned my attention to God. In my torn garments, I knelt before Him and stretched out my hands to the Eternal God.
